summary: This document appears to be a transcript of a deposition or interview where MS. NOEL is being questioned about signing training documents for SHU suicide prevention training that she did not actually receive due to being out on injury from March to June 2019. The interviewer is an OIG special agent.

persons.name: Ms. Noel
persons.context: Employee being questioned about signing training documents for SHU suicide prevention training that she did not actually receive due to being out on injury from March to June 2019.

persons.name: OIG Special Agent
persons.context: Conducting the interview/deposition, asking questions about training documentation and signing procedures.

connections.description: The OIG special agent is questioning Ms. Noel about her training documentation and signing procedures.

events.title: SHU Suicide Prevention Training
events.description: Training session that Ms. Noel was documented as having conducted, but she claims she did not receive due to being out on injury.

events.title: Ms. Noel's Injury Leave
events.description: Ms. Noel went out on injury leave starting in March 2019 and returned in June 2019.

keyFacts: Ms. Noel signed training documents for SHU suicide prevention training conducted on June 26, 2019, but she did not actually receive that training.
Ms. Noel was out on injury leave from March 2019 to June 2019, and was told to sign the training documents upon her return in June.
The document reveals potential issues with training documentation procedures where employees may be signing for training they did not receive.
